intro: Grammitis anisophylla, commonly known as the variable huperbole, is a species of fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, moss-like appearance and intricate leaf structures. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often on rocks or tree trunks in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are usually bi- or tri-pinnate, with varying leaflet shapes that contribute to its common name. Grammitis anisophylla plays a role in forest ecosystems by providing microhabitats for various small organisms.
